entries.title: Apple iPhone: Can India be China’s ‘plus one’ to the world?
entries.description: Can India become the new manufacturing hub as global firms try to reduce their dependence on China?

entries.title: The farmers caught up in Taiwan's tensions with China
entries.description: Taiwanese fruit growers are unable to sell their crop after Beijing banned their importation.

entries.title: Space, the unseen frontier in the war in Ukraine
entries.description: It is the first war where commercial space capabilities have played a significant role, a US general says.

entries.title: Will UK royals follow the Danish downsizing?
entries.description: Could the British Royal Family have its own "slimming down" in the footsteps of Denmark's queen?

entries.title: Ukraine designers fight back at Paris Fashion Week
entries.description: How Ukraine's "indomitable" fashion designers are showcasing their work in the French capital.

entries.title: The generations of Iranian women fighting for freedom
entries.description: The protests currently sweeping the country have their roots in changes made after the 1979 revolution.

entries.title: Lebanon financial crisis: The people robbing banks to get their own money
entries.description: Bank customers in Lebanon cannot withdraw more than $400 a month, owing to the financial crisis.

entries.title: Fat Bear Week: Race is on for Alaska's bulkiest bear
entries.description: Alaskan bears stuffing themselves for the winter have gained a loving audience around the world.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: The intrigue & inspiration behind first women's tournament of 1991
entries.description: Memories differ and rumours abound but the first women's Rugby World Cup can be certain of its game-changing legacy.

entries.title: Man City 5-0 Copenhagen: Pep Guardiola dismisses Erling Haaland release clause rumours as 'not true'
entries.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says reports in Spain that Erling Haaland's contract contains a special release clause for him to join Real Madrid in 2024 are "not true".

entries.description: The PM will attend a new meet-up of European leaders, boosting hopes of a reset in UK-EU relations.

entries.title: Sevilla 1-4 Borussia Dortmund: Jude Bellingham stars as Germans claim emphatic win
entries.description: England midfielder Jude Bellingham scores one and sets up another as Borussia Dortmund ease past Sevilla to tighten their grip on second place in Group G.

entries.title: Chelsea 3-0 AC Milan: Blues produce emphatic and deserved win over Serie A giants
entries.description: Chelsea get their first win of this season's Champions League with an emphatic and fully deserved victory over AC Milan.

entries.title: RB Leipzig 3-1 Celtic: Ange Postecoglou wants more from callow side
entries.description: Celtic boss Ange Postecoglou says his side need to have more belief in their ability to hurt teams if they're to make progress in the Champions League.

entries.title: Kilmarnock 2-1 St Johnstone: Armstrong brace earns hosts victory
entries.description: A Danny Armstrong double gave Kilmarnock a comfortable win over St Johnstone in the Scottish Premiership

entries.title: Dog death, driving and emails: The strange history of the 'October surprise'
entries.description: Surprising news stories about candidates are not uncommon in US politics before November elections.

entries.title: Vladimir Putin at 70: Seven pivotal moments that made him
entries.description: As Vladimir Putin turns 70, we look back at a series of turning points that helped shape his worldview.

entries.title: Liz Truss's speech ends showcase of dysfunction and division
entries.description: Growth is just one of many problems facing the Tory government, the BBC's political editor says.

entries.title: Putin vows to 'stabilise' annexed regions as Ukraine makes gains
entries.description: Ukraine continues to take back territory from Russia but Moscow says it will regain it.

entries.title: RB Leipzig 3-1 Celtic: Scottish champions' hopes dented in Germany
entries.description: Celtic's hopes of progressing in the Champions League were dented after RB Leipzig eventually triumphed in a frantic and entertaining contest.

entries.title: LIV Golf claims players can earn ranking points after Mena Tour agreement
entries.description: LIV Golf signs a "strategic alliance" with the Middle East and Africa (Mena), Tour which it claims will allow its players to earn world ranking points.

entries.title: Scotland v Austria: Scots must be fearless in Women's World Cup play off
entries.description: Preview followed by live coverage of Thursday's Women's World Cup Qualifying game between Scotland and Austria.

entries.title: Conor Benn v Chris Eubank Jr: Eddie Hearn says 'There's a process we have to go through'
entries.description: Conor Benn's promoter Eddie Hearn says that Benn is "not suspended" by the British Boxing Board of Control, but the board needs to be "comfortable" before the fight with Chris Eubank Jr can take place.

entries.title: Faisal Islam: Truss plan must tackle more than taxes

entries.title: Women's World Cup play-off: Wales v Bosnia-Herzegovina
entries.description: Wales manager Gemma Grainger urges her side to seize the chance to make history against Bosnia-Herzegovina.

entries.title: School vows it 'won't hide away' over online racist abuse

entries.title: Opec: What is it and what is happening to oil prices?

entries.title: Primark re-introduces women-only fitting rooms

entries.title: Jessica Lawson drowning: Teachers not guilty over girl's death in France

entries.title: FIA delays publication of its inquiries into whether any team breached F1 budget cap in 2021

entries.title: Steve Cooper to remain Nottingham Forest manager following club meetings

entries.title: Alec Baldwin shooting: Filming to resume after Halyna Hutchins death on set

entries.title: Jose Mourinho and Sir Alex Ferguson phrases added to Oxford English Dictionary

entries.title: World Cup: Ukraine joins Spain and Portugal's bid to host 2030 tournament

entries.title: Lincoln CCTV captures man's near miss at level crossing

entries.title: Mark Drakeford urged to withdraw 'insulting' Covid group comments

entries.title: Church of England abuse cases in hundreds - report

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England add four to squad for Fiji warm-up

entries.title: Moving On Up: M People founder livid song was used by PM

entries.title: Conor Benn in 'adverse' drug test before Chris Eubank Jr fight

entries.title: Liz Truss speech: PM pledges to get country through 'stormy days'
entries.description: Liz Truss admits her economic policies will cause disruption but says "the status quo is not an option".

entries.title: Former whisky shop worker returns to buy company

entries.title: Worcester Warriors: WRFC Players Ltd wound up in High Court

entries.title: Average two-year mortgage rate highest for 14 years

entries.title: Lost Bristol 'wonder pup' stuns owner after city adventure

entries.title: Gateshead stabbing: Tomasz Oleszak, 14, named as victim

entries.description: Chemistry Nobel goes to Carolyn Bertozzi, Morton Meldal, and Barry Sharpless.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Irishman Rory Mason killed fighting for International Legion

entries.title: Steve Thompson: Rugby World Cup winner describes impact of dementia

entries.title: MLB: Aaron Judge breaks American League record with 62nd home run of season
entries.description: Watch as Aaron Judge of the New York Yankees sets a new American League record with his 62nd home run of the season.

entries.title: Dolly Parton leads tributes to Loretta Lynn
entries.description: "I miss her dearly," says the star, after fellow country singer Loretta Lynn dies at the age of 90.

entries.title: Tesco: People watching every penny to make ends meet

entries.title: Chris Eubank Jr v Conor Benn: Tony Bellew shuts down Eubank '60%' claims
entries.description: In his BBC Sport column, Tony Bellew says all the pressure is on Chris Eubank Jr in his fight against Conor Benn on Saturday night.

entries.title: Ellie Goulding: 'I don't mind having fun on TikTok'
entries.description: "The music industry definitely isn't the same as when I started out," Ellie tells Newsbeat.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England's Simon Middleton on Yorkshire upbringing
entries.description: Simon Middleton reflects on a hard-working, Yorkshire upbringing that led to him helping England make history.

entries.title: Hans Niemann 'likely cheated' in more than 100 games, investigation finds
entries.description: It is likely Hans Niemann has cheated "much more often" than he has acknowledged, an investigation finds.

entries.title: Northampton teenage sisters highlighting diversity in children's books
entries.description: Two teenage sisters are trying to highlight a wider diversity of characters in children's books.

entries.title: Banksy kept under spare bed to go on display in Salford
entries.description: The owner of Leopard and Barcode has kept it wrapped in a blanket under a bed for a decade.

entries.title: St Bernadette: The religious relics drawing crowds across the country
entries.description: A golden box featuring parts of St Bernadette is drawing thousands of people to cathedrals.

entries.title: Chris Eubank Jr v Conor Benn: Eubank 'believes' legendary father will be in his corner for fight
entries.description: Chris Eubank Jr says he "believes" his father Chris Eubank Sr will be one of his three corner men when he faces Conor Benn on Saturday but admits he isn't 100% sure.

entries.title: Cost of living: The people using solar panels and turbines to reduce bills
entries.description: Meet the people who are choosing alternative ways to heat their homes and keep their bills down.

entries.title: Kadeena Cox: British Paralympic champion says people question her disability
entries.description: Kadeena Cox says living with hidden disabilities can feel like "fighting a losing battle" because of negative reactions from people.

entries.title: South Korea military apologises after failed missile launch sparks alarm
entries.description: Social media posts showing what appeared to be an explosion caused some residents in Gangneung to panic.

entries.title: Asteroid struck by Nasa probe leaves 10,000km trail

entries.title: Newspaper headlines: Truss speech to 'rally MPs' amid claims of a 'coup'
entries.description: The papers preview Liz Truss's Conservative conference speech as infighting in the party continues.

entries.title: Police in England and Wales pledge to attend every home burglary
entries.description: It follows a report which found victims of burglary were not being given the justice they deserve.

entries.title: Angelina Jolie accuses Brad Pitt of abuse on private plane
entries.description: Angelina Jolie says Brad Pitt grabbed her head and attacked two of their children, which he denies.

entries.title: Eating within set times good for shift workers
entries.description: Time-restricted eating reduced blood pressure and cholesterol in a study of US firefighters.
